chapter.title: Installing the Apache 2.2 Policy Agent
chapter.para: This chapter covers installation of the policy agent for Apache HTTP Server 2.2.x.

section.title: Installing Apache 2.2 Web Policy Agent
section.para: Complete the following procedures to install the policy agent.

procedure.title: To Install the Policy Agent into Apache 2.2

step.para: Shut down the Apache 2.2 server where you plan to install the agent.
Make sure OpenAM is running.
Run ./agentadmin --install to install the agent.
step.screen:
$ cd /path/to/web_agents/apache22_agent/bin/ $ ./agentadmin --install --acceptLicense ... ----------------------------------------------- SUMMARY OF YOUR RESPONSES ----------------------------------------------- Apache Server Config Directory : /path/to/apache22/conf OpenAM server URL : http://openam.example.com:8080/openam Agent URL : http://www.example.com:80 Agent Profile name : Apache Web Agent Agent Profile Password file name : /tmp/pwd.txt
... SUMMARY OF AGENT INSTALLATION ----------------------------- Agent instance name: Agent_001 Agent Bootstrap file location: /path/to/web_agents/apache22_agent/Agent_001/config/
Agent Configuration Tag file location /path/to/web_agents/apache22_agent/Agent_001/config/
Agent Audit directory location: /path/to/web_agents/apache22_agent/Agent_001/logs/audit Agent Debug directory location: /path/to/web_agents/apache22_agent/Agent_001/logs/debug
Install log file location: /path/to/web_agents/apache22_agent/installer-logs/audit/install.log ...
step.para: Upon successful completion, the installer has added the agent as a module to the Apache 2.2 configuration, and also set up configuration and log directories for the agent.

note.para: If the agent is in a different domain than the server, refer to Administration Guide procedure, Configuring Cross-Domain Single Sign On.

step.para: Take note of the configuration files and log locations.

Each agent instance that you install on the system has its own numbered configuration and logs directory. The first agent's configuration and logs are thus located under the directory web_agents/apache22_agent/Agent_001/.

listitem.para: Used to bootstrap the web policy agent, allowing the agent to connect to OpenAM and download its configuration
Only used if you configured the web policy agent to use local configuration
Operational audit log directory, only used if remote logging to OpenAM is disabled
Debug directory where the amAgent debug file resides. Useful in troubleshooting policy agent issues.

step.para: If your policy agent configuration is not in the top-level realm (/), then you must edit config/ to identify the sub-realm that has your policy agent configuration. Find com.sun.identity.agents.config.organization.name and change the / to the path to your policy agent profile. This allows the policy agent to properly identify itself to the OpenAM server.
Start the Apache 2.2 server where you installed the agent.

procedure.title: To Check the Policy Agent Installation

step.para: Check the Apache 2.2 error log after you start the server to make sure startup completed successfully.
step.screen: $ tail -n 2 /path/to/apache22/logs/error_log [Sat Sep 03 13:28:16 2011] [notice] Policy web agent shared memory conf... [Sat Sep 03 13:28:16 2011] [notice] Apache/2.2.19 (Unix) DSAME/3.0 configured -- resuming normal operations

step.para: Check the amAgent debug log to verify that no errors occurred on startup.

If you have a policy configured, you can test your policy agent. For example, try to browse to a resource that your policy agent protects. You should be redirected to OpenAM to authenticate, for example as user demo, password changeit. After you authenticate, OpenAM then redirects you back to the resource you tried to access.

section.title: Installing Apache 2.2 Web Policy Agent (Windows)
section.para: The instructions for installing the Apache 2.2 Web Policy Agent on a Windows system mirror those on the Unix/Linux systems. Run the following procedures.

procedure.title: Before You Begin
procedure.para: First read the pre-install requirements in .

step.para: Make sure you have installed Apache HTTP server. Stop the HTTP server prior to installing the Apache 2.2 Web Policy Agent.
Make sure you have an installed and running OpenAM server. The OpenAM server should be installed and running with at least one policy agent profile configured.
Unzip the file in the directory where you plan to install the web policy agent.

procedure.title: To Create the Apache 2.2 Web Agent Profile

step.para: Follow the instructions presented in Configuring Web Policy Agent Profiles to create the profile.
Create a text file containing only the password.
Open the Properties dialog on the password file, click the Read-only box, and then click OK.

procedure.title: To Install the Policy Agent into Apache 2.2

step.para: Shut down the Apache 2.2 server where you plan to install the agent.
Make sure OpenAM is running.
Change to the Web Agent directory.
Install the agent. When prompted for information, enter the inputs appropriate for your deployment.

section.title: Custom Apache 2.2 Web Policy Agent Installation
section.para: When running multiple Apache 2.2 servers on the same host, use ./agentadmin --custom-install. If you want to suppress the license agreement prompt, add the --acceptLicense option to the command.

When performing a scripted, silent installation, use ./agentadmin --install --saveResponse response-file to create a response file for scripted installation. Then install silently using ./agentadmin --install --acceptLicense --useResponse response-file.

With ./agentadmin --custom-install, you can opt to create the policy agent profile during installation. The OpenAM administrator must first create an agent administrator user, as described in Delegating Agent Profile Creation, and provide you with the agent administrator user name and password. Before running the ./agentadmin --custom-install command, put the password alone in a read-only file only the user installing can access, as for the agent password. When the agentadmin command prompts you to create the profile during installation, enter true, and then respond to the agentadmin prompts for the agent administrator user name and password file.

section.title: Remove Apache 2.2 Web Policy Agent Software
section.para: Shut down the Apache 2.2 server before you uninstall the policy agent.
To remove the web policy agent, use ./agentadmin --uninstall.

$ ./agentadmin --uninstall ... ----------------------------------------------- SUMMARY OF YOUR RESPONSES ----------------------------------------------- Apache Server Config Directory : /path/to/apache22/conf
